1.t: Ta. Sin. These are the verses of the Quran and of the illustrious Book
1.tr: Taa-Seeen; tilka Aayaatul Qur-aani Wa-Kitaabim Mubeen

2.t: They are glad news and guidance for the believers

3.t: who are steadfast in prayer, who pay the religious tax, and who have strong faith in the life hereafter.
3.tr: Allazeena yuqeemoonas Salaata Wa-yu'toonaz Zakaata Wa-hum bil-Aakhirati hum yooqinoon

4.t: We have made the deeds of those who do not believe in the life to come, attractive to them and they wander about blindly.
4.tr: Innal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil-Aakhirati zaiyannaa lahum a'maalahum fahum ya'mahoon

5.t: They will suffer the worst kind of torment and will be lost in the life to come.
5.tr: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena lahum sooo'ul 'azaabi Wa-hum fil Aakhirati humul akhsaroon

6.t: (Muhammad), you have certainly received the Quran from the All-wise and All-knowing One.
6.tr: Wa-innaka latulaqqal Qur-aana mil ladun Hakeemin 'Aleem

7.t: Moses said to his family, "I have seen some fire. I shall bring you some news about it or some fire so that you can warmyourselves".
7.tr: Iz qaala Moosaa li-ahliheee inneee aanastu naaran saaateekum minhaa bikhabarin aw aateekum bishihaabin qabasil la'allakum tastaloon

8.t: When he approached the fire, he was told, "Blessed is the one in the fire and those around it. All glory belongs to God, the Lord of the Universe.
8.tr: Falammaa jaaa'ahaa noodiya am boorika man fin naari Wa-man hawlahaa Wa-Subhaanal laahi Rabbil 'aalameen

9.t: Moses, I am God, the Majestic and All-wise.

10.t: Throw down your staff." When Moses saw his staff on the ground moving like a living creature, he stepped back and did not come forward again. The Lord said,"Moses, do not be afraid. Messengers do not become afraid in My presence".
10.tr: Wa-alqi 'asaak; falammmaa ra-aahaa tahtazzu ka-annahaa jaaannunw wallaa mudbiranw Wa-lam yu'aqqib; yaa-Moosaa laa takhaf innee laa yakhaafu ladaiyal mursaloon

11.t: Only the unjust become afraid in My presence. Even to these people who replace their bad deeds by good ones, I am All-forgiving and All-merciful.
11.tr: Illaa man zalama summa baddala husnam ba'da sooo'in fa-innee Ghafoorur Raheem

12.t: Put your hand into your pocket. It will come out sheer white but unharmed. This is one of the nine miracles which shall be showing to the Pharaoh and his people; they are truly wicked men."
12.tr: Wa-adkhil yadaka fee jaibika takhruj baidaaa'a min ghairi sooo'in fee tis'i Aayaatin ilaa Fir'awna Wa-qawmih; innahum kaanoo qawman faasiqeen

13.t: When Our miracles were visibly shown to them, they said, "It is plain magic".
13.tr: Falammaa jaaa'at-hum Aayaatunaa mubsiratan qaaloo haazaa sihrum mubeen

14.t: They rejected the evidence because of their arrogance and injustice, although their souls knew it to be true. Think how terrible the end of the sinful ones was!
14.tr: Wa-jahadoo bihaa wastaiqanat-haaa anfusuhum zulmanw wa-'uluwwaa; fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mufsideen

15.t: We gave knowledge to David and Soloman. They said, "It is only God who deserves all praise. He has exalted us above many of His believing servants."
15.tr: Wa-laqad aatainaa Daawooda Wa-sulaimaana 'ilmaa; Wa-qaalal hamdu lil-laahil lazee faddalanaa 'alaa kaseerim min 'ibaadihil mu'mineen

16.t: Solomon became the heir to David. He said, "People, we have been taught the language of the birds and have been granted a share of everything. This indeed is a manifest favor (from God)".
16.tr: Wa-warisa Sulaimaanu Daawooda Wa-qaala yaaa-aiyuhan naasu 'ullimnaa mantiqat tairi Wa-ooteenaa min kulli shai'in inna haazaa lahuwal fadlul mubeen

17.t: Soloman's army, consisting of human beings, jinn, and birds were gathered together in his presence in ranks.
17.tr: Wa-hushira Sulaimaana junooduhoo minal jinni wal-insi wattairi fahum yooza'oon

18.t: When they arrived in the valley of the ants, one ant said to the others, "Enter your dwellings lest you be carelessly crushed by Soloman and his army."
18.tr: hattaaa izaaa ataw 'alaa waadin namli qaalat namlatuien yaaa-aiyuhan namlud khuloo masaakinakum laa yahtimannakum Sulaimaanu Wa-junooduhoo Wa-hum laa yash'uroon

19.t: (Solomon) smiled at the ant's remarks and said, "Lord, inspire me to thank you for Your favors to me and my parents and to act righteously so as to please you. Admit me, by your mercy into the company of Your righteous servants".
19.tr: Fatabassama daahikam min qawlihaa Wa-qaala Rabbi awzi'nee an ashkura ni'mata-kal lateee an'amta 'alaiyya Wa-'alaa waalidaiyya Wa-an a'mala saalihan tardaahu Wa-adkhilnee birahmatika fee 'ibaadikas saaliheen

20.t: (Solomon) inspected the birds and said, "How is it that I cannot see the hoopoe. Is he absent?
20.tr: Wa-tafaqqadat taira faqaala maa liya laaa araa al-hudhuda, am kaana minal ghaaa'ibeen

21.t: I shall certainly punish him severely or slaughter him unless he has a good reason for his absence."
21.tr: La-u'azzibanahoo 'azaaban shadeedan aw la-azbahannahoo aw layaatiyannee bisultaanim mubeen

22.t: Not long after the hoopoe came forward and said, "I have information which you do not have. I have come from the land of Sheba with a true report.
22.tr: Famakasa ghaira ba'eedin faqaala ahattu bimaa lam tuhit bihee Wa-ji'tuka min Sabaim binaba-iny yaqeen

23.t: I found a woman ruling the people there and she possessed something of (almost) everything and a great throne.
23.tr: Innee wajattum ra-atan tamlikuhum Wa-ootiyat min kulli shai'inw Wa-lahaa 'arshun 'azeem

24.t: I found her and her people prostrating before the sun instead of God. Satan has made their deeds attractive to them. He has kept them away from the right path and they have no guidance.
24.tr: Wajattuhaa Wa-qawmahaa yasjudoona lishshamsi min doonil laahi Wa-zaiyana lahumush Shaitaanu a'maalahum fasaddahum 'anis sabeeli fahum laa yahtadoon

25.t: (Satan has done this) so that they will not worship God who brings forth whatever is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows whatever you conceal or reveal.
25.tr: Allaa yasjudoo lillaahil lazee yukhrijul khab'a fis samaawaati wal-ardi Wa-ya'lamu maa tukhfoona Wa-maa tu'linoon

26.t: God is the only Lord and master of the Great Throne."
26.tr: Allaahu laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa Rabbul 'Arshil Azeem

27.t: Solomon said, "We shall see whether you are truthful or a liar.
27.tr: Qaala sananzuru asadaqta am kunta minal kaazibeen

28.t: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then return and see what their reply will be."
28.tr: Izhab bikitaabee haaza fa-alqih ilaihim summma tawalla 'anhum fanzur maazaa yarji'oon

29.t: (The Queen of Sheba) said to her officials, "A gracious letter has been dropped before me.
29.tr: Qaalat yaaa-aiyyuhal mala'u innee ulqiya ilaiya kitaabun kareem

30.t: It reads, 'From Soloman. In the Name of God, the Beneficent and the Merciful.
30.tr: Innahoo min Sulaimaana Wa-innahoo bismil laahir Rahmaanir Raheem

31.t: Do not consider yourselves superior to me but come to me as Muslims (in submission)".

32.t: She said, "My officials, what are your views on this matter? I will not decide until I have your views.
32.tr: Qaalat yaaa-aiyyuhal mala'u aftoonee fee amree maa kuntu qaati'atan amran hattaa tashhhaddon

33.t: They replied, "We have great power and valor. You are the commander, so decide as you like".
33.tr: Qaaloo nahnu uloo quwwatinw Wa-uloo baasin shadeed; wal-amru ilaiki fanzuree maazaa taamureen

34.t: She said, "When Kings enter a town they destroy it and disrespect its honorable people. That is what they will do, too.
34.tr: Qaalat innal mulooka izaa dakhaloo qaryatan afsadoohaa Wa-ja'alooo a'izzata ahlihaaa azillah; Wa-kazaalika yaf'aloon

35.t: I will send a gift and we shall see what response the Messengers will bring."
35.tr: Wa-innee mursilatun ilaihim bihadiyyatin fanaaziratum bima yarji'ul mursaloon

36.t: When her Messengers came to Soloman, he said, "Have you brought me wealth? What God has given to me is far better than what He has given to you, but you are happy with your gifts.
36.tr: Falammaa jaaa'a Sulaimaana qaala atumiddoonani bimaalin famaaa aataaniyal laahu khairum mimmmaaa aataakum bal antum bihadiy-yatikum tafrahoon

37.t: Go back to your people and we shall soon come there with an army which they will not be able to face. We shall drive them from their town, humble, and disgraced."
37.tr: Irji' ilaihim falanaatiyan-nahum bijunoodil laa qibala lahum bihaa Wa-lanukhri-jannahum minhaaa azillatanw Wa-hum saaghiroon

38.t: Solomon asked his people, "Who among you can bring her throne before (she, the queen of Sheba) comes to me submissively?"
38.tr: Qaala yaaa-aiyyuhal mala'u aiyyukum yaateenee bi'arshihaa qabla aien yaatoonee muslimeen

39.t: A monstrous jinn said, "I can bring it before you even stand up. I am powerful and trustworthy".
39.tr: Qaala 'ifreetum minal jinni ana aateeka bihee qabla an taqooma mim maqaamika Wa-innee 'alaihi laqawiyyun ameen

40.t: The one who had knowledge from the Book said, "I can bring it to you before you even blink your eye." When Solomon saw the throne placed before him, he said, "This is a favor from my Lord by which He wants to test whether I am grateful or ungrateful. Whoever thanks God does so for his own good. Whoever is ungrateful to God should know that my Lord is Self-Sufficient and Benevolent."
40.tr: Qaalal lazee indahoo 'ilmum minal Kitaabi ana aateeka bihee qabla aien yartadda ilaika tarfuk; falammaa ra-aahu mustaqirran 'indahoo qaala haazaa min fadli Rabbee li-yabluwaneee 'a-ashkuru am akfuru Wa-man shakara fa-innamaa yashkuru linafsihee Wa-man kafara fa-inna Rabbee Ghaniyyun Kareem

41.t: Then he said, "Make a few changes to her throne and let us see whether she will recognize it or not."
41.tr: Qaala nakkiroo lahaa 'arshahaa nanzur atahtadeee am takoonu minal lazeena laa yahtadoon

42.t: When she came she was asked, "Is your throne like this?" She replied, "It seems that this is it. We had received the knowledge before this and were submissive (to Solomon's power)".
42.tr: Falammaa jaaa'at qeela ahaakaza 'arshuki qaalat kaanna hoo; Wa-ooteenal 'ilma min qablihaa Wa-kunnaa muslimeen

43.t: Her idols prevented her from believing in God and she was an infidel.
43.tr: Wa-saddahaa maa kaanat ta'budu min doonil laahi innahaa kaanat min qawmin kaafireen

44.t: She was told to enter the palace. When she saw it, she thought that it was a pool and raised her clothe up to her legs. Solomon said, "This is a palace constructed with glass." She said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself and I submit myself with Solomon to the will of God, the Lord of the Universe."
44.tr: Qeela lahad khulis sarha falammaa ra-at-hu hasibat-hu lujjatanw Wa-khashafat 'an saaqaihaa; qaala innahoo sarhum mumarradum min qawaareer; qaalat Rabbi innee zalamtu nafsee Wa-aslamtu ma'a Sulaimaana lillaahi Rabbil 'aalameen

45.t: We sent to the tribe of Thamud their brother Salih so that they would worship God, but they became two quarrelling groups.
45.tr: Wa laqad arsalnaaa ilaa Samooda akhaahum Saalihan ani'budul lahha fa-izaa hum fareeqaani yakhtasimoon

46.t: Salih said, "My people, why do you commit sins so quickly before doing good? Would that you ask forgiveness from God so that perhaps He will have mercy upon you."
46.tr: Qaala yaa-qawmi lima tasta'jiloona bissaiyi'ati qablal hasanati law-laa tas-taghfiroonal laaha la'allakum turhamoon

47.t: They said, "We have an ill omen about you and your followers." Salih replied, God has made your ill fortune await you. You are a people on trial."
47.tr: Qaalut taiyyarnaa bika Wa-bimam ma'ak; qaala taaa'irukum 'indal laahi bal antum qawmun tuftanoon

48.t: There were nine tribes in the city spreading evil without any reform in the land.
48.tr: Wa-kaana fil madeenati tis'atu rahtien yufsidoona fil ardi Wa-laa yuslihoon

49.t: They said, "Let us swear by God to do away with him and his family during the night then tell his guardian that we did not see how he and his family had been destroyed, and we shall be telling the truth."
49.tr: Qaaloo taqaasamoo billaahi lanubaiyyitannahoo Wa-ahlahoo summaa lanaqoolana liwaliy-yihee maa shahidnaa mahlika ahliee Wa-innaa lasaadiqoon

50.t: They plotted and We planned without their knowledge. Consider the result of their plot.
50.tr: Wa-makaroo makranw Wa-makarnaa makranw Wa-hum laa yash'uroon

51.t: We destroyed them and their people altogether.
51.tr: Fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatu makrihim annaa dammar-naahum Wa-qawmahum ajma'een

52.t: Those are their empty houses which We ruined because of their injustice. In this there is evidence (of the truth) for the people of knowledge.
52.tr: Fatilka buyootuhum khaa-wiyatam bimaa zalamoo; inna fee zaalika la-Aayatal liqaw-mien ya'lamoon

53.t: We saved the faithful God-fearing believers.

54.t: Lot asked his people, "Do you understandably commit indecency?
54.tr: Wa-lootan iz qaala liqawmiheee ataatoonal faa-hishata Wa-antum tubsiroon

55.t: Do you have carnal relations with men rather than women? You are ignorant people".
55.tr: A'innakum lataatoonar rijaala shahwatam min doonin nisaaa'; bal antum qawmun tajhaloon

56.t: His people had no answer but to say, "Expel Lot and his family from the town for they want to be pure."
56.tr: Famaa kaana jawaaba qawmiheee illaaa an qaalooo akhrijooo aalaa Lootim min qaryatikum innahum unaasuny yatatahharoon

57.t: We saved (Lot) and his family except his wife who was destined to remain behind.
57.tr: Fa-anjainaahu Wa-ahlahooo illam ra-atahoo qaddarnaahaa minal ghaabireen

58.t: We sent to them a terrible rainstorm. How horrible was the rain for the people who had already received warning.

59.t: (Muhammad), say, "It is only God who deserves all praise. Peace be upon His chosen servants. Which is better God or the idols?
59.tr: Qulil hamdu lillaahi Wa-salaamun 'alaa 'ibaadihil lazeenas tafaa; aaallaahu khairun ammmaa yushrikoon

60.t: "(Are the idols worthier or) the One who has created the heavens and the earth, who has sent water from the sky for you, who has established delightful gardens and you could not even plant one tree? Is there any Lord besides God? In fact, the unbelievers are the ones who deviate from the right path.
60.tr: Amman khalaqas samaawaati wal-arda Wa-anzala lakum minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa-anbatnaa bihee hadaaa'iqa zaata bahjah; maa kaana lakum an tunbitoo shajarahaa; 'a-ilaahun ma'al laah; bal hum qawmuien ya'diloon

61.t: "(Are the idols worthier or) the One who has made the earth a resting place, the rivers flow from its valleys, the mountains as anchors and a barrier between the two seas? Is there any lord besides God? In fact, most people do not know.
61.tr: Ammann ja'alal arda qaraaranw Wa-ja'ala khilaalahaaa anhaaranw Wa-ja'ala lahaa rawaasiya Wa-ja'ala bainal bahraini haajizaa; 'a-ilaahun ma' allah; bal aksaruhum laa ya'lamoon

62.t: "(Are the idols worthier or) the One who answers the prayers of the distressed ones, removes their hardship, and makes you the successors in the land? Is there any lord besides God? In fact, you take very little heed.
62.tr: Ammaien yujeebul mud-tarra izaa da'aahu Wa-yakshifus sooo'a Wa-yaj'alukum khula-faaa'al ardi 'a-ilaahun ma' allaah qaleelan maa tazak-karoon

63.t: "(Are the idols worthier or) the One who guides you in the darkness of the land and sea and sends the winds bearing the glad news of His mercy? Is there any lord besides God? God is too exalted to be considered equal to anything else.
63.tr: Ammaien yahdeekum fee zulumaatil barri wal bahri Wa-maien yursilu riyaaha bushran baina yadai rahmatih; 'a-ilaahun ma'allah; Ta'aalal laahu 'ammaa yushrikoon

64.t: "(Are the idols worthier or) the One who began the creation and who will turn it back, who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth? Is there any lord besides God? Say, "Bring your proof if what you say is true."
64.tr: Ammaien yabda'ul khalqa thumma yu'eeduhoo Wa-maien yarzuqukum minas sammaaa'i wal ard; 'a-ilaahun ma'allah; qul haatoo burhaanakum in kuntum saadiqeen

65.t: (Muhammad) say, "No one in the heavens or the earth knows the unseen except God, and no one knows when they will be resurrected.
65.tr: Qul laa ya'lamu man fis sammaawaati wal-ardil ghaiba illal laah; Wa-maa yash'uroona aiyaana yub'asoon

66.t: Their knowledge of the next life is no more than doubts. In fact, they are blind about it.
66.tr: Balid daaraka 'ilmuhum fil Aakhirah; bal hum fee shakkin minhaa bal hum minhaa 'amoon

67.t: The unbelievers have said, "Shall we and our fathers be brought out of the graves after we become dust?
67.tr: Wa-qaalal lazeena kafarooo 'a-izaa kunnaa turaabanw Wa-aabaaa'unaaa a'innaa lamukhrajoon

68.t: It was promised to us and to our fathers before us. It is only ancient legends."
68.tr: Laqad wu'idnaa haazaa nahnu Wa-aabaaa'unaa min qablu in haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen

69.t: Say, "Travel through the land and see how terrible was the end of the criminal ones".
69.tr: Qul seeroo fil ardi fanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mujrimeen

70.t: (Muhammad), do not be grieved (about their disbelief) nor distressed about their evil plans against you.
70.tr: Wa-laa tahzan 'alaihim Wa-laa takun fee daiqin mimmaa yamkuroon

71.t: They ask, "When the Day of Judgment will come, if it is true at all?"
71.tr: Wa-yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen

72.t: Say, "Perhaps some of the things which you wish to experience immediately are very close to you."
72.tr: Qul 'asaaa aien yakoona radifa lakum ba'dul lazee tasta'jiloon

73.t: Your Lord has many favors for mankind but most of them are ungrateful.
73.tr: Wa-inna Rabbaka lazoo fadlin 'alan naasi Wa-laakinna aksarahum laa yashkuroon

74.t: Your Lord certainly knows whatever their hearts conceal or reveal.
74.tr: Wa-inna Rabbaka la-ya'lamu maa tukinnu sudooruhum Wa-maa yu'linoon

75.t: All the secrets in heavens and earth are recorded in the illustrious Book.
75.tr: Wa-maa min ghaaa'ibatin fis samaaa'i wal-ardi illaa fee kitaabin mubeen

76.t: This Quran tells the Israelites most of the matters about which they had disputes among themselves.
76.tr: Inna haazal Qur-aana yaqussu 'alaa Baneee israaa'eela aksaral lazee hum feehi yakhtalifoon

77.t: It is a guide and mercy for the believers.

78.t: Your Lord will judge among them according to His own decree. He is Majestic and All-Knowing.
78.tr: Inna Rabbaka yaqdee bainahum bihukmih; Wa-Huwal 'Azeezul 'Aleem

79.t: Trust in God for you follow the manifest truth.

80.t: You cannot make the dead listen and the deaf are unable to hear calls. Thus, they turn back on their heels.
80.tr: Innaka laa tusmi'ul mawtaa Wa-laa tusmi'us summad du'aaa izaa wallaw mudbireen

81.t: You cannot guide the straying blind ones. You can only make hear those who believe in Our revelations submissively.
81.tr: Wa-maaa anta bihaadil-'umyi 'an dalaalatihim in tusmi'u illaa mai yu'minu bi aayaatinaa fahum muslimoon

82.t: When the word about them comes true We shall make a creature appear to them on earth who will tell them that people had no faith in Our revelations.
82.tr: Wa-izaa waqa'al qawlu 'alaihim akhrajnaa lahum daaabbatan minal ardi tukal-limuhum annan naasa kaanoo bi-aayaatinaa laa yooqinoon

83.t: On the day when We resurrect from every nation a group from among those who had rejected Our revelations, they will be kept confined in ranks.
83.tr: Wa-Yawma nahshuru min kulli ummatin fawjan mimmaien yukazzibu bi-Aayaatinaa fahum yooza'oon

84.t: When they will be brought into the presence of God, He will ask them, "Did you reject My revelations without fully understanding them. What did you know about them if you had any knowledge at all?
84.tr: Hattaaa izaa jaaa'oo qaala akazzabtum bi-Aayaatee Wa-lam tuheetoo bihaa 'ilman ammaazaa kuntum ta'maloon

85.t: They will become subject to punishment because of their injustice. Thus, they will not speak.
85.tr: Wa-waqa'al qawlu 'alaihim bimaa zalamoo fahum laa yantiqoon

86.t: Have they not seen that We have created the night for them to rest and the day for them to see. In this there is evidence for the believing people.
86.tr: Alam yaraw annaa ja'alnal laila li-yaskunoo feehi wannahaara mubsiraa; inna fee zaalika la-Aayaatil liqaw-mien yu'minoon

87.t: Everyone in the heavens and earth will be terrified on the day when the trumpet will be sounded except those whom God will save. Everyone will humbly come into the presence of God.
87.tr: Wa-Yawma yunfakhu fis Soori fafazi'a man fis samaawaati Wa-man fil ardi illaa man shaaa'al laah; Wa-kullun atawhu daakhireen

88.t: You think the mountains are solid. In fact, they move like clouds. It is God's technique which has established everything perfectly. He is well Aware of what you do.
88.tr: Wa-taral jibaala tahsabuhaa jaamidatanw Wa-hiya tamurru marras sahaab; sun'al laahil lazeee atqana kulla shai'; innahoo khabeerun bimaa taf'aloon

89.t: Whoever does a good deed will receive a better reward than what he has done. He will be secure from the terror of the Day of Judgment.
89.tr: Man jaaa'a bil-hasanati falahoo khairun minhaa Wa-hum min faza'ien Yawma'izin aaminoon

90.t: Those who commit evil will be thrown headlong into hell fire. (It will be said to them) can you expect any recompense other than what you deserve for your deeds?
90.tr: Wa-man jaaa'a bissai-yi'ati fakubbat wujoohuhum fin Naari hal tujzawna illaa maa kuntum ta'maloon

91.t: I am commanded to worship the Lord of this town which He has made sacred. To Him belong all things. I am commanded to be a Muslim
91.tr: Innamaaa umirtu an a'buda Rabba haazihil baldatil lazee harramahaa Wa-lahoo kullu shai'inw Wa-umirtu an akoona minal muslimeen

92.t: and recite the Quran. Whoever seeks guidance will find it for his own soul. Say to whoever goes astray, "I am only a warner".
92.tr: Wa-an atluwal Qur-aana famanih tadaa fa-innamaa yahtadee linafsihee Wa-man dalla faqul innamaaa ana minal munzireen

93.t: Say, "It is only He who deserves all praise. He will soon show you His signs and you will recognize them. Your Lord is not unaware of what you do.
93.tr: Wa-qulil hamdu lillaahi sa-yureekum Aayaatihee fa-ta'rifoonahaa; Wa-maa Rabbuka bighaafilin 'ammaa ta'maloon
